titleproper.value: Guide to the Charles Davis Research Files <num>TAM 444</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Processed by Nicole Greenhouse

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-06-06T19:20:46</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

abstract.value: This collection contains the research files of Charles Davis. The collection mostly contains pamphlets on the development of Pittsburgh and other labor-related writings.

p.value: Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1996.021.

While the identity of Charles Davis is unknown, the presence in the collection of an article from the January, 1936 issue of <emph render="italic">Economic Notes</emph>, the periodical of the Communist-associated Labor Research Association, may reflect the left political sympathies of Mr. Davis.

Contains pamphlets, writings and reports pertaining to the research interests of Charles Davis. Included are a number of United States Agriculture Department reports, pamphlets and other materials on Pittsburgh's urban planning, and research project material on women workers in Brazil. The materials span from the 1920s to the 1940s.
